briefdescription.para: default parameters - there may be better ways, but this will do

detaileddescription.para: This should be set by some static class function during the overall configuration - perhaps by an RoiBuilder class

flag this as a composite RoI
flag to determine whether consituents should be managed

parameterdescription.para: if fullscan is true, this RoI will span the entire detector

inbodydescription.para: if full scan, give it full detector limits just in case anyone doesn't bother to check whether the fullscan flag is set Fixme: these fullscan limits probably need to be set from somewhere constistently. static class variables ???

inbodydescription.para: manging it's own constituents, so take a deep copy
these are already managed elsewhere, just copy the pointers

these quantities probably don't need to be used any more
they are implemented here only because we had them in the original legacy interface

memberdef.argsstring: (double eta, double etaMinus, double etaPlus, double phi, double phiMinus, double phiPlus, double zed, double zedMinus, double zedPlus)
memberdef.name: construct

briefdescription.para: construct RoiDescriptor internals - similar to constructors

inbodydescription.para: NB: deal with float to double issue This is a hack for the region selector - the RS uses double precision for the phi=pi boundary because the RoiDescriptor only uses a float, so pi is represented as 3.14159274 which is > M_PI so we have to subtract 1e-7 a bit to prevent it failing any phi>M_PI conditions
NB: see comment in double RoiDescriptor::phiPlus()
calculate the gradients - very useful these

briefdescription.para: Describes the Region of Ineterest geometry It has basically 9 parameters.

listitem.para: zed : central z position of RoI
zedMinus : most negative z position of the roi
zedPlus : most positive z position of the roi
phi : azimuthal angle (radians) of "centre" of RoI at origin in range from [-pi, pi]
phiMinus : the most clockwise (negative phi direction) phi value for the RoI
phiPlus : the most anti-clockwise (positive phi direction) phi value for the RoI
